{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3531433,"name":"Aj2Veldh","username":"AndrVeld","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/9de0a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T14:47:57.679Z","cooked":"

We recently setup our arm using a position value of 0 as straight horizontal, 0.25 as straight down, and -0.25 as straight up. We have an absolute encoder that’s 1:1 with the mechanism, its not a CANcoder its a duty cycle encoder, so we’re simply using it to subtract an offset from the arm position when the robot boots up so we know where the arm has started, following boot up we only use the internal encoder on the kraken for position movement. We are using the SensorToMechanismRatio to achieve the position values I mentioned above. We’re using motion magic to control the position.

I was having an issue with the gravity feedforward gain. I set all gains to 0 and set the gravity type to arm cosine, and applied a Kg value then told the arm to move to a position of 0 (straight horizontal). The arm instead seemed to try to maintain a position close to 0.25 (straight down). Additionally when I disable the robot the arm briefly kicks out towards a horizontal position.

Are there any issues with this implementation that would be causing these problems?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T14:47:57.679Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":148,"reads":168,"readers_count":167,"score":773.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492169,"topic_slug":"ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm","display_username":"Aj2Veldh","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33472,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm/492169/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3531479,"name":"","username":"AvocadoPeel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/avocadopeel/{size}/232401_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T15:31:41.298Z","cooked":"

pretty sure +0.25 should be up and -0.25 should be down for the kG to operate in the correct direction. im guessing right now its just applying kG down instead of up.

edit: im also guessing the “kick” is the motor is pushing against a hardstop at the bottom and when you disable the robot the motor releases from the hardstop and jumps up a bit

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T15:32:52.691Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":146,"readers_count":145,"score":44.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492169,"topic_slug":"ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm/492169/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531500,"name":"Aj2Veldh","username":"AndrVeld","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/9de0a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T15:52:58.860Z","cooked":"

I was wondering if the +0.25 and -0.25 being flipped was a problem, I didn’t think it would matter, gravity should apply the same in that range but its something to try anyway.

In terms of the kick the motor is not against a hardstop at the bottom, it seems as though some power is applied right when I hit disable that causes the arm to swing out slightly. This did only happen at high Kg values

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T15:52:58.860Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":141,"readers_count":140,"score":38.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492169,"topic_slug":"ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm","display_username":"Aj2Veldh","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":61239,"username":"AvocadoPeel","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/avocadopeel/{size}/232401_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33472,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm/492169/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531540,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T16:17:37.201Z","cooked":"

The direction does matter because we assume that positive output goes upwards from 0 towards 0.25. Otherwise you would need a negative kG.

Another thing to note, our arm kG is a feedback term; it uses the current position of the arm to calculate kG rather than the arm setpoint. This is because we found several situations where using the setpoint does not behave well, whereas our 1 kHz PID controller can easily use the measured position without introducing system instability. So the arm kG will always be enough to hold whatever position the arm is in, you need to separately drive it towards the target.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T16:22:03.532Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":105.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492169,"topic_slug":"ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm","display_username":"Benjamin Hall","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33472,"username":"AndrVeld","name":"Aj2Veldh","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/9de0a6/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48146,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm/492169/4","custom_user_title":"Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531567,"name":"Aj2Veldh","username":"AndrVeld","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/9de0a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T16:35:21.924Z","cooked":"

Okay that makes sense thanks!

I’m still a little confused on the proper process to determine a Kg gain. If I need to separately drive the arm towards its target wouldn’t it be somewhat ambiguous as to whether the PID gains are too low or the Kg is too low if its not reaching it’s target? Would it work to manually move the arm out to horizontal and adjust Kg gains to maintain that position without any other gain values?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T16:35:21.924Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":39.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492169,"topic_slug":"ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm","display_username":"Aj2Veldh","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48146,"username":"bhall-ctre","name":"Benjamin Hall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33472,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm/492169/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531603,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T16:58:45.755Z","cooked":"

Place the arm at horizontal. Increase voltage until it just begins to move upwards. Decrease until it just begins to fall.

The average of the two voltages is a good estimate of kG, and half their difference is a good estimate of kS.

You can run this routine with a joystick and a dashboard in about 10 seconds. It’s a really good one.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T16:59:51.363Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":21,"reads":109,"readers_count":108,"score":206.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492169,"topic_slug":"ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33472,"username":"AndrVeld","name":"Aj2Veldh","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/9de0a6/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm/492169/6","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531661,"name":"Aj2Veldh","username":"AndrVeld","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/9de0a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T17:30:31.828Z","cooked":"

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T17:30:31.828Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":40.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492169,"topic_slug":"ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm","display_username":"Aj2Veldh","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33472,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm/492169/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531725,"name":"AllenGregoryIV","username":"AllenGregoryIV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allengregoryiv/{size}/65531_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T18:29:23.664Z","cooked":"
bhall-ctre:

The direction does matter because we assume that positive output goes upwards from 0 towards 0.25. Otherwise you would need a negative kG.

Is there a suggested way to set this up for an arm that can move to both sides of the robot? So that it is has a horizontal position in two different places.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T18:29:23.664Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":34.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492169,"topic_slug":"ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm","display_username":"AllenGregoryIV","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":10647,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm/492169/8","custom_user_title":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531806,"name":"Jan","username":"Jazonk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jazonk/{size}/183000_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T19:28:39.181Z","cooked":"

You’ll want to keep everything positive as much as possible - IE a stow position of vertical upwards being 90 degrees. For the kG, you end up using a cosine function to calculate the component you need for any given arm angle. We did this on our 2023 bot which had a very similar setup with elevator/arm/wrist.

CTRE assumes that 0 degrees on the arm is horizontal. So you’d have a positive kG on one side and a negative on the other.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T19:37:08.054Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":30.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492169,"topic_slug":"ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm","display_username":"Jan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":10647,"username":"AllenGregoryIV","name":"AllenGregoryIV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allengregoryiv/{size}/65531_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9486,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6800 Controls Mentor | 27 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm/492169/9","custom_user_title":"6800 Controls Mentor | 27 Alum","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531814,"name":"Wolly :)","username":"wolly_efendi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wolly_efendi/{size}/165245_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T19:33:45.919Z","cooked":"
Wesley Aptekar-Cassels

Intro to Control Theory Part 5: Feed Forward and Motion Profiling

How feedforward and motion profiling can help make everything happy

Another example of what @Jazonk said, with 1678’s 2016 bot (not truly feedforward because it uses the arm angle but it removes gravity from the equation).

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T19:34:43.813Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":39.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492169,"topic_slug":"ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm","display_username":"Wolly :)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://blog.wesleyac.com/posts/intro-to-control-part-five-feedforward-motion-profiling","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Wesley Aptekar-Cassels | Intro to Control Theory Part 5: Feed Forward and Motion Profiling","clicks":11}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":10647,"username":"AllenGregoryIV","name":"AllenGregoryIV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allengregoryiv/{size}/65531_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49878,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ctre-talon-fx-gravity-feedforward-for-arm/492169/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531824,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T19:40:36.384Z","cooked":"

As long as 0 is horizontally forward and 0.25 is vertically upward, then everything will work with a positive kG. We take the cos of the angle, so anything from (0.25, 0.75) will result in negative output, correctly holding the arm up.
